name: PositionOptions.maximumAge
description: The PositionOptions.maximumAge property is a positive long value indicating the maximum age in milliseconds of a possible cached position that is acceptable to return. If set to 0, it means that the device cannot use a cached position and must attempt to retrieve the real current position. If set to Infinity the device must return a cached position regardless of its age.

refs.name: Geolocation API
refs.description: The definition of 'PositionOptions.maximumAge' in the 'Geolocation API' specification.
